publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3709 Bruce Crawford: Westfield Public Inquiry-That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive to hold a full public inquiry into the planning application lodged by Alba Resource Recovery Ltd with Fife Council for their site at Westfield, Fife, which is now subject to an appeal to the Executive by Alba, given the application's strategic importance for Scotland and the potential detrimental environmental effects on the communities of Ballingry, Benarty, Kinglassie and surrounding villages.

S1M-3709 Bruce Crawford: Westfield Public Inquiry-That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive to hold a full public inquiry into the planning application lodged by Alba Resource Recovery Ltd with Fife Council for their site at Westfield, Fife, which is now subject to an appeal to the Executive by Alba, given the application's strategic importance for Scotland and the potential detrimental environmental effects on the communities of Ballingry, Benarty, Kinglassie and surrounding villages. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Richard Lochhead*
S1M-3709 Westfield Public Inquiry (lodged on 12 December 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Alasdair Morgan*, Fiona McLeod*, Tricia Marwick*, Robin Harper*, Brian Adam*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3709 Westfield Public Inquiry (lodged on 12 December 2002) Michael Matheson*
S1M-3709 Westfield Public Inquiry (lodged on 12 December 2002) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-3709 Westfield Public Inquiry (lodged on 12 December 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3709 Westfield Public Inquiry (lodged on 12 December 2002) Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-3709 Westfield Public Inquiry (lodged on 12 December 2002) Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-3709 Bruce Crawford: Westfield Public Inquiry—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive to hold a full public inquiry into the planning application lodged by Alba Resource Recovery Ltd with Fife Council for their site at Westfield, Fife, which is now subject to an appeal to the Executive by Alba, given the application’s strategic importance for Scotland and the potential detrimental environmental effects on the communities of Ballingry, Benarty, Kinglassie and surrounding villages. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Richard Lochhead, Stewart Stevenson, Alasdair Morgan, Fiona McLeod, Tricia Marwick, Robin Harper, Brian Adam, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Ms Sandra White, Mr Keith Raffan, Mr Kenny MacAskill
